name: CostaBaja Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at the CostaBaja. Wonderful views, very clean hotel, confortable and modern, but the most important is the really good service representated by the supervisor Sylvain Paruy.
reviews.title: Amazing Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The large Marina besides the Hotel is a great option to whom wants be a fisherman for a couple of days. The "pangas" can pick you up and drop you off there at the end of the day. Very easy!
reviews.title: Wonderful quiet place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant Steinbecks is amazing with a good chef.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort!

reviews.text: Costa Baja is a great little hotel, just a few miles from downtown La Paz, with spectacular views, very nice, comfortable and super-clean rooms, two great restaurants and a beach club. Service is fantastic. We particularly enjoyed the food at Mosaic. Waiters Freddie and Jose were outstanding.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a quick, kidless getaway to Costa Baja May30-June 4. I cannot say enough positive things about this resort. Please, please, please Lord, let me be able to go back here someday!!!!!!
reviews.title: Nice Resort... but

reviews.text: It's ok for people looking for a decent hotel, however it is not a luxury resort.
reviews.title: Not a Luxury Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It does have a spa and a golf course, very clean.
reviews.title: Only played golf...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The villas are ultra small and way up the hill. We had reserved one (family of 6 with 4 kids).
reviews.title: Best place to stay in La Paz

reviews.text: Ask for a beachfront condo instead. They are way more spacious and comfortable. Staff is very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: A very nice place

reviews.text: My wife and I have had the opportunity to play Costa Baja Golf Club a number of times. This Gary Player designed course is a fun test of golf with tremendous views of the bay of La Paz. There are numerous tee boxes to fit anyone's game. The fairways are generous and the greens challenging but not impossible. The elevation changes are really dramatic!! This is one of Mr. Players really good designs. He uses the land well.
reviews.title: Better than expected!
The most luxurious La Paz has to offer!
reviews.text: This is a stunning resort located just outside of town. The rooms are top notch and there are several restaurants and activities within the complex. As much as I enjoyed my stay here i felt it was too far out of town and secluded from the experiences I was looking forward to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights last month in a sea view room. The taxi journey was short from the bus station where we got dropped off on the ecobaja shuttle from Cabo airport and immediately we were impressed with the look of the Costabaja development. The open airy lobby is lovely and the rooms are modern and well appointed although some may not like the slightly odd glass shower cubicle right in the middle of the room. Service was always friendly with Israel in particular a stand out helpful guy. We ate at the Italian restaurant at the Marina in the evenings and the food was excellent and fairly reasonably priced for a upscale resort - you can charge the bill to your hotel bill which is convenient. We also took and excellent tour to Spiritu Sanctu Island to swim with the sealions with Fun Baja who are also at the marina - all arranged by the hotel. There has clearly been a large investment in the CB development and I hope that it pays off as its in a lovely spot and will certainly be back. Pretty faultless couple of days - only service glitch was terrible service at Hemingways - gave up after 3 attempts to order a drink and went elsewhere. Otherwise a real bargain and worth the 3 hr trip from Cabo.
reviews.title: Really is good

reviews.text: Amazing area, great property, rooms are awesome. By far the best hotel in La Paz as the gateway to the magnificent Sea of Cortez. Kids friendly too!! Some rooms have great views of the Sea of Cortez. The Costa Baja Marina area offers great dinner options. Steinbecks restaurant in the hotel has a great athmosphere and food is awesome.
reviews.title: Love La Paz

reviews.text: This resort is a fair way out of the main centre, but some people might like that. The rooms are really great and to a high international standard. The positioning of the hotel is a little strange, but the environment is nice. The pool is small, but there is a swim up bar if thats your thing.
reviews.title: relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is good, but the rest of the food is fairly ordinary. If you don't want to head into town, stroll around to the marina and there are a few options.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do I begin? We had not been to La Paz before but we wanted to try some place new. CostaBaja kept coming up with very positive reviews. So we took a chance and booked 8 nights. I will tell you that my wife was very apprehensive about La Paz. Needless to say by the time we left she was wanting to extend out visit.
reviews.title: OMG

reviews.text: We had room 405 (if you go ask for fourth floor) beach view. The room was very good by any standard. Some people do not like the glass shower in the middle of the room. It was different which is why we liked it. The balcony view was spectacular. The evenings were cool enough that we left the sliding door open and listened to the waves breaking gently on the beach. Our room had a small refrigerator. The staff was very attentive and quickly learned your name and of course your drink of preference. I dont recall all of their names but special thanks to Jose, Leopoldo and Israel. The morning breakfast buffet was excellent lots of choices every day. The beach club also had excellent food. We were always so stuffed from breakfast that we would order the octopus appetizer or ceviche and share it for lunch. The restuarants in the Marina are very good, but dont forget to go into La Paz to experience the wonderful restuarants. There is a free shuttle bus or a cab (120 pesos). If you are a golfer there is a Gary Player golf course at the resort worth trying. My wife tried the spa and had very positive reviews.
reviews.title: The best in the town, but far from I expect from a 4 star resort.

reviews.text: The CostaBaja is a world class resort and ranks right up there in our top 2 best resorts. Negatives..... I am thinking ok Internet bankwidth could be improved on the beach. Really we had no negatives. We are already planning our next visit to CostaBaja.
reviews.title: Spectacular View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is not what it looks in the web site. I don`t know if you like, but the shower in the middle of the room with all glass instead of walls, it simple feels out of place. No body helped us with our luggage, because no body was there. In a ¨5 ¨star hotel , well... The big door only opens saturday & sundays, so if you get there on a friday you will have to sneak in by a very small door. The lobby has an amateur decoration, it is overdone, and a mixture of elements. The pool had only one person to help you with the towels, and amazing only 2 umbrellas for the whole zone ¡¡ so,.... be prepared for a lot of sun. The good part: a good buffet for breakfast. So making the overall : 5 less than good. 1 very good.
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent one night there for a wedding and found the hotel very worth it! The amenities were first class, the room was very clean with a balcony and view of the ocean and marina. The buffet breakfast was great and the service first class, they brought me my eggs and whatever else I wanted from the buffet. A lot of people checked out at the same time but it was smooth and my car was brought very quickly. I would recommend this hotel very highly. My daughters were also staying there and they said that room service was quick and good.
reviews.title: A 5 star Resort all the way.

description: CostaBaja™ Resort and Spa is just 10 minutes south from downtown La Paz, the capital of Baja California Sur. The resort is set on the magnificent Sea of Cortez overlooking a 250-slip double-basin marina and a white sand beach. Just north of the hotel, lies Isla Espiritu Santo where you'll discover one of the greatest marine reserves in the world, along with the best sport fishing in Baja Sur. Endless Activities and Options on the Sea of Cortez Within the resort, activities are endless! Costa Baja offers exclusive access and preferred rates at Mexico's only Gary Player-designed golf course, the tranquil Espiritu Spa – featuring locally-inspired treatments and full spa services, three pools, as well as multiple dining options. Unmatched Guest Rooms and Acommodations: Unmatched in La Paz, Costa Baja features luxuriously-appointed resort hotel rooms with views of the surrounding area, private balconies and 24-hour room service. Coming soon to Costa Baja will be Grand Heritage Residence Club Condominiums.
